Medical Officer Job at Sickle Cell Foundation Nigeria (SCFN)




        
    

        
        Sickle Cell Foundation Nigeria (SCFN) - Founded with a deep commitment to improving the lives of individuals affected by sickle cell disorder. Sickle Cell Foundation Nigeria (SCFN) has been at the forefront of advocacy, research, and patient care since its inception. Established to address the overwhelming burden of sickle cell disorder in Nigeria—home to the largest population of people living with the condition globally—the Foundation has played a pivotal role in driving awareness, fostering innovation, and providing comprehensive support systems.
     

            
    



Through a dedicated approach that encompasses education, treatment, and community engagement, SCFN has made significant strides in alleviating the challenges faced by those living with sickle cell disorder, while also championing policies that promote better healthcare outcomes. Today, the Foundation continues to be a beacon of hope and a leader in the global fight against sickle cell disorder.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Officer

Job Location: Nigeria

Description


	We are seeking passionate and highly competent professionals to join our team and strengthen the delivery of life-saving services to persons living with Sickle Cell Disorder.


Job Role


	The Medical Officer will support clinical services, patient care, research activities, and community health initiatives in line with the Foundation’s mandate.


Requirements


	Relevant academic and professional qualifications
	 Demonstrated experience in a similar role
	Strong communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume and LinkedIn URL to: caudu@sicklecellfoundation.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Officer",
  "description": "Africa Food Changemakers,&nbsp;established in 2022 through the merger of two sister organizations (Nourishing Africa and Changing Narratives Africa), Africa Food Changemakers is a subsidiary Non-profit arm of Sahel Consulting.&nbsp;At AFC, we support African agripreneurs to start and scale resilient and sustainable agribusinesses that nourish Africa and the world. AFC is committed to changing global narratives about Africa by celebrating Africa&rsquo;s contributions to the global food ecosystem, showcasing Africa&rsquo;s innovations and cooking methods, amplifying and scaling proudly African food and beverage brands, and ensuring that more people globally experience the diversity and richness of the continent&rsquo;s gastronomic heritage and exciting future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Role Purpose


	The Human Resources Officer is responsible for supporting the effective management of the organisation&rsquo;s people by implementing HR policies, managing employee lifecycle processes, ensuring compliance with labour laws and donor requirements, and fostering a positive, values-driven work environment aligned with the organisation&rsquo;s mission.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Onboarding:


	Coordinate end-to-end recruitment, including job postings, screening, interviews, and onboarding
	Support workforce planning for programmes and projects


HR Operations &amp; Administration:


	Manage employee records, contracts, confirmations, promotions, and exits
	Maintain accurate personnel files and HR documentation
	Track leave, attendance, and HR records


Performance Management:


	Support performance appraisal cycles and follow-ups
	Track probation reviews and performance improvement actions


Policies, Compliance &amp; Governance:


	Implement HR policies and ensure compliance with labour laws and donor requirements
	Support HR audits, donor reviews, and compliance reporting
	Assist in updating HR policies and the employee handbook


Employee Relations &amp; Welfare:


	Serve as a first point of contact for staff HR inquiries
	Support grievance handling and disciplinary processes
	Promote employee wellbeing, inclusion, and respectful workplace practices


Learning, Culture &amp; Engagement:


	Support staff training and capacity-building initiatives
	Assist with employee engagement surveys and culture initiatives
	Promote organisational values and ethical standards


HR Data &amp; Reporting:


	Prepare HR reports on headcount, recruitment, leave, and training
	Support the use of HRIS and digital HR tools


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Timely recruitment and onboarding
	Accurate and compliant HR records
	Completion of performance reviews
	Policy compliance and audit readiness
	Employee engagement and satisfaction indicators


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Social Sciences, or related field
	2&ndash;4 years of relevant HR experience (NGO or development sector preferred)
	Knowledge of labour laws and HR best practices
	HR certification (CIPM) is an advantage


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong organisational and communication skills
	High level of confidentiality and professionalism
	Attention to detail and strong follow-through
	Ability to work independently in a mission-driven environment
	Cultural sensitivity and alignment with NGO values.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruiting@afchub.org&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Human Resources Officer Job at Africa Food Changemakers




        
    

        
        Africa Food Changemakers, established in 2022 through the merger of two sister organizations (Nourishing Africa and Changing Narratives Africa), Africa Food Changemakers is a subsidiary Non-profit arm of Sahel Consulting. At AFC, we support African agripreneurs to start and scale resilient and sustainable agribusinesses that nourish Africa and the world. AFC is committed to changing global narratives about Africa by celebrating Africa’s contributions to the global food ecosystem, showcasing Africa’s innovations and cooking methods, amplifying and scaling proudly African food and beverage brands, and ensuring that more people globally experience the diversity and richness of the continent’s gastronomic heritage and exciting future.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer

Job Location: Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Role Purpose


	The Human Resources Officer is responsible for supporting the effective management of the organisation’s people by implementing HR policies, managing employee lifecycle processes, ensuring compliance with labour laws and donor requirements, and fostering a positive, values-driven work environment aligned with the organisation’s mission.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment & Onboarding:


	Coordinate end-to-end recruitment, including job postings, screening, interviews, and onboarding
	Support workforce planning for programmes and projects


HR Operations & Administration:


	Manage employee records, contracts, confirmations, promotions, and exits
	Maintain accurate personnel files and HR documentation
	Track leave, attendance, and HR records


Performance Management:


	Support performance appraisal cycles and follow-ups
	Track probation reviews and performance improvement actions


Policies, Compliance & Governance:


	Implement HR policies and ensure compliance with labour laws and donor requirements
	Support HR audits, donor reviews, and compliance reporting
	Assist in updating HR policies and the employee handbook


Employee Relations & Welfare:


	Serve as a first point of contact for staff HR inquiries
	Support grievance handling and disciplinary processes
	Promote employee wellbeing, inclusion, and respectful workplace practices


Learning, Culture & Engagement:


	Support staff training and capacity-building initiatives
	Assist with employee engagement surveys and culture initiatives
	Promote organisational values and ethical standards


HR Data & Reporting:


	Prepare HR reports on headcount, recruitment, leave, and training
	Support the use of HRIS and digital HR tools


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Timely recruitment and onboarding
	Accurate and compliant HR records
	Completion of performance reviews
	Policy compliance and audit readiness
	Employee engagement and satisfaction indicators


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Social Sciences, or related field
	2–4 years of relevant HR experience (NGO or development sector preferred)
	Knowledge of labour laws and HR best practices
	HR certification (CIPM) is an advantage


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong organisational and communication skills
	High level of confidentiality and professionalism
	Attention to detail and strong follow-through
	Ability to work independently in a mission-driven environment
	Cultural sensitivity and alignment with NGO values.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruiting@afchub.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
